content: For a long time I have wondered why those in the military have to pay a federal income tax. After all it is taxes that fund the military so why tax the military in order for the government to pay it back into the military salaries. If the military didn’t have to pay federal income tax then that in effect would amount to a significant raise for the military. Anyone have any thoughts on this?
reply: For a long time I have wondered why those in the military have to pay a federal income tax. After all it is taxes that fund the military so why tax the military in order for the government to pay it back into the military salaries. If the military didn’t have to pay federal income tax then that in effect would amount to a significant raise for the military. Anyone have any thoughts on this?
title: Why do those in the military pay federal income tax?

content: quote: Originally posted by IHAWKER: For a long time I have wondered why those in the military have to pay a federal income tax. After all it is taxes that fund the military so why tax the military in order for the government to pay it back into the military salaries. If the military didn’t have to pay federal income tax then that in effect would amount to a significant raise for the military. Anyone have any thoughts on this? "into the valley of death rode the six hundred" "it's not the reason why, it's but to do or die" Shortened it a bit but I think the message is there.

content: Crackerjacks, can you start a new thread about the fair tax? I haven't much time to review it, but a good discussion on this issue, and the tax issue within itself would be great. As to paying federal taxes. Think of it this way, that little we all contributed, went to things like ships, aircraft, tanks, beans, bullets, go go juice, base improvements and so on. It was an investment for us all. Now, the abuses of that money is another story (in which I have posted about elsewhere). Now, maybe they can take the money that the military pays in taxes, and use it strictly for......the military!
reply: Crackerjacks, can you start a new thread about the fair tax? I haven't much time to review it, but a good discussion on this issue, and the tax issue within itself would be great. Now, maybe they can take the money that the military pays in taxes, and use it strictly for......the military!

content: We pay taxes for the same reason all other federal employees do. If all federal employees stopped paying income tax what would the loss of revenue be?
reply: We pay taxes for the same reason all other federal employees do. If all federal employees stopped paying income tax what would the loss of revenue be?
title: Why do those in the military pay federal income tax?

content: It's not as if we don't enjoy (?) or at least use the things and services those taxes buy: common defense (us), criminal justice, food and drug oversight, nuclear energy/program oversight, aircraft/airline/aeronautics oversight, space exploration, national parks, coastal search and rescue (USCG), border security, energy management, agricultural oversight, federal highway system oversight ... the list is endless. Why should we be any different from our fellow citizens, since we come from their ranks and return to them? We're not an elite, mercenary group ... we're just a bunch of folks who think military service is service to this country and its ideals. Who also like to fly, or jump out of airplanes, or live underwater for months, or blow things up, or something.
reply: It's not as if we don't enjoy (?) or at least use the things and services those taxes buy: common defense (us), criminal justice, food and drug oversight, nuclear energy/program oversight, aircraft/airline/aeronautics oversight, space exploration, national parks, coastal search and rescue (USCG), border security, energy management, agricultural oversight, federal highway system oversight ... the list is endless. Why should we be any different from our fellow citizens, since we come from their ranks and return to them? We're not an elite, mercenary group ... we're just a bunch of folks who think military service is service to this country and its ideals. Who also like to fly, or jump out of airplanes, or live underwater for months, or blow things up, or something.
title: Why do those in the military pay federal income tax?

title: Why do those in the military pay federal income tax?

content: quote: Originally posted by dragonflyer04: As citizens we pay taxes except when deployed overseas (combat ops)... it would be a quick raise if they stopped the taxes from being taken out. More like it could be a quick raise. When it's all said and done, you pay, what, about 14% of your gross income in fed income tax alone? Eliminate that tax, you're giving something like a 15% raise all at once. Great. Wonderful. It eliminates any pressure for Congress to keep trying to catch military pay up the the private sector, eliminates most incentive to do annual 3%+ raises, etc. Or, we can start a movement to repeal the 16th amendment and force the federal government to run using service fees and excise taxes.
quote: Originally posted by dragonflyer04: As citizens we pay taxes except when deployed overseas (combat ops)... it would be a quick raise if they stopped the taxes from being taken out.
reply: More like it could be a quick raise. When it's all said and done, you pay, what, about 14% of your gross income in fed income tax alone? Eliminate that tax, you're giving something like a 15% raise all at once. Great. Wonderful. It eliminates any pressure for Congress to keep trying to catch military pay up the the private sector, eliminates most incentive to do annual 3%+ raises, etc. Or, we can start a movement to repeal the 16th amendment and force the federal government to run using service fees and excise taxes.

content: Don't forget that you can make unintentional mistakes like our Treasury Secretary. Don't pay tax on your military pay because you mistakenly thought it wasn't taxable. That would also qualify you for an Obama cabinet position. Or like Rep. Charels Rangle (D NY) just say you didn't think it was taxable. The IRS will only collet part of the taxes owed and there will be no fines or penalties.

content: quote: Originally posted by crackerjacks61: Foreign nationals like Filipino's do not have to pay income tax when they are in our military. That use to burn my azz. If we had the Fairtax, they would have paid as well. That's rather incorrect. I am a foreign national (South African citizenship) and I pay just as much tax as the next joe. The only people who do not have to pay federal income tax are those from US territories. Unless I completely misunderstood your question, I suggest you do some research.
quote: Originally posted by crackerjacks61: Foreign nationals like Filipino's do not have to pay income tax when they are in our military. That use to burn my azz. If we had the Fairtax, they would have paid as well.

content: I payed taxes when I was in and had no problem with it. What burned me up was when they changed the tax laws to include BAQ and Seperate Rats. I used to get the earned income credit and then they started adding the BAQ and Sep. Rats on as income so I then I "made" too much to get the earned income credit. They didn't tax them, just added them in as income. The tax guy told me it was non taxible taxible income ??? Only the Government could come up with that oxymoron.
reply: I payed taxes when I was in and had no problem with it. What burned me up was when they changed the tax laws to include BAQ and Seperate Rats. I used to get the earned income credit and then they started adding the BAQ and Sep. Rats on as income so I then I "made" too much to get the earned income credit. They didn't tax them, just added them in as income. The tax guy told me it was non taxible taxible income ??? Only the Government could come up with that oxymoron.

title: Why do those in the military pay federal income tax?

content: Don't forget that you can make unintentional mistakes like our Treasury Secretary. Don't pay tax on your military pay because you mistakenly thought it wasn't taxable. That would also qualify you for an Obama cabinet position. Or like Rep. Charels Rangle (D NY) just say you didn't think it was taxable. The IRS will only collet part of the taxes owed and there will be no fines or penalties.

content: quote: Originally posted by crackerjacks61: Foreign nationals like Filipino's do not have to pay income tax when they are in our military. That use to burn my azz. If we had the Fairtax, they would have paid as well. That's rather incorrect. I am a foreign national (South African citizenship) and I pay just as much tax as the next joe. The only people who do not have to pay federal income tax are those from US territories. Unless I completely misunderstood your question, I suggest you do some research.
quote: Originally posted by crackerjacks61: Foreign nationals like Filipino's do not have to pay income tax when they are in our military. That use to burn my azz. If we had the Fairtax, they would have paid as well.

title: Why do those in the military pay federal income tax?

content: My stepson was a foreign national from the Philippines when he enlisted in the Army & he was certainly required to pay taxes just like the rest of us. He enlisted in 1994 & is still in the Army & still paying taxes.
reply: My stepson was a foreign national from the Philippines when he enlisted in the Army & he was certainly required to pay taxes just like the rest of us. He enlisted in 1994 & is still in the Army & still paying taxes.

title: Why do those in the military pay federal income tax?

content: I payed taxes when I was in and had no problem with it. What burned me up was when they changed the tax laws to include BAQ and Seperate Rats. I used to get the earned income credit and then they started adding the BAQ and Sep. Rats on as income so I then I "made" too much to get the earned income credit. They didn't tax them, just added them in as income. The tax guy told me it was non taxible taxible income ??? Only the Government could come up with that oxymoron.
reply: I payed taxes when I was in and had no problem with it. What burned me up was when they changed the tax laws to include BAQ and Seperate Rats. content: quote: Originally posted by IHAWKER: For a long time I have wondered why those in the military have to pay a federal income tax. After all it is taxes that fund the military so why tax the military in order for the government to pay it back into the military salaries. If the military didn’t have to pay federal income tax then that in effect would amount to a significant raise for the military. Anyone have any thoughts on this? Could just cut the wages by that amount, right? But then you wouldn't get anything back on your income tax return - - Wandering and Wondering
